title: Re: Keen Official Games Thread
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I have keen6 version 1.4, and a screen appears at the beginning saying that it has "rawcopy pc TSR patch."[hr][/quote]

RawCopy is an old program that was used to bypass the copy protection in most old dos programs. Most often (I think) it worked via running a TSR (Terminate, Stay Resident... i.e. a "background" program), which would not actually change the exe, but would "interact" with it once it got to the copy protection portion. However, I think it also sometimes simply patched the .exe itself.

title: Re: Problem with patching
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I have keen6 version 1.4, and a screen appears at the beginning saying that it has "rawcopy pc TSR patch." I also noticed that the speed jumps when I first enter a level, and then balances out. Is that normal?[hr][/quote]
If you check your Keen 6 directory, you will notice that you have two executable files Keen6.com and Keen6.exe. Keen6.exe is the actual Keen executable while Keen6.com is a small loader file which will load a patch into memory, then run Keen6.exe. The purpose of the patch is to bypass the Keen 6 "enemy identification" screen.

Because of DOS' precedence rules, if you type just "keen6", it's the COM file that is run, thus invoking the patch. If you explicitly type "keen6.exe", the game will start without the patch and you'll notice that you will be asked to identify an enemy when starting or loading a game.

title: Re: Problem with patching
content:
But Cho'gall, I still get the screen asking for enemies names. Either the patch isnt working or it's for something else. I always thought it had to do with memory replacement/conversion, considering its a TSR patch, and the jump in speed as you enter a level. There's also a ridiculously long 'level loading' time.

Edit: When I ran Keen6.exe, it did run without the patch, but the patch seemed to make it run more smoothly overall (discounting the initial speed jump).[img]http://www.angelfire.lycos.com/mech/roboblue/Robo_Blue.gif[/img] [url=http://www.angelfire.lycos.com/mech/roboblue]Official Keenbound Site[/url]

title: Intriguing...
content:
Highly unusual... did you download it from somewhere else? It seems that download link isn't actually working, so perhaps you were forced to find another location? If that's the case, you may have a weird version--the version I'm using doesn't support anything other than TIFF, PCX, BMP or TIFF... and BMP is default.

Edit: Try [url=http://medlem.spray.se/converters/]this site[/url]. Download c2jpg120.zip. It's meant to convert all sorts of formats, including PICT, into JPG.

>Commander Spleen

Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"The irritating notion that the beholder should complete through his imagination what the artist left undone is refuted by the sumi paintings, so fond of incomplete objects. Try to complete the rocks whose base is lost in the mist or to populate the "empty" spaces with more rocks or woods, and you will find that your clumsy moves destroy the delicate balance and thus the meaning."

title: Re:
content: Ok I see it's old, but ScreenThief saves BMP-files with compression. Compressed bitmaps can't be read by most painting tools, including Paint. There is a /compression- option in Screen Thief to turn it off(if you have that proper version)

title: Help me find Commander Keen Game
content:
To all Commander Keen enthusiasts out there, please help me. In the early to mid 1990's I remember playing a version of Commander Keen. He was in his back yard with his pogo stick and would jump on the slugs to squish them. He went down a hole and would do the same. I believe he went to the pyramids and a mine and under the ocean. These are the only scenarios I remember from this versin of the game.

Can somebody please tell me the name of that game and version. I just do not recall and I think I am lookin in the wrong area.

Please email me at: georgeph38@yahoo.com

I would greatly appreciate this.

Thank you in advance,

George!

title: Re: Help me find Commander Keen Game

"Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!"
-- NAJAWA --

title: Ooh, blurry memories.
content:
It sounds more like 12 years or so away from Keen has warped your mind. Your description is probably of Commander Keen 4: The Secret of the Oracle, which can be download at the start of this thread.

There are slugs, but you shoot them rather than squish them. However, there are oversized mosquitoes, called Skypests, which can be squished.

The game doesn't actually take place in Billy's back yard, but the scene shows up in the Star Wars style story screen during the demo sequence.

Finally, there are indeed pyramids and an underwater level (though it's not until a bit later in the game that you can reach it). There aren't really any mines, though there are places that could be said to resemble them. There are mines in Keen Dreams, though--perhaps you've played that and your memory has blurred the two games together.

Look like the game you're after? Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

content:

title: Re: Keen Official Games Thread
content:
I don't know which version the id Anthology has, but there is a registered version of the game. The difference is that the files are named like Keen 4-6 (LevelLord also said the format is more similar), and those stupid ads won't be displayed. There is a screen which tells you some warnings if you didn't pay for the product when it starts and then a Keen 4-6 like initializing screen appears.

EDIT: Damn, I didn't notice you meant the registered version from Gamer's Edge

title: Re: Keen Official Games Thread
content:
I answered my own question........[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

Keen dreams from id anthology is different from the keen

dreams gamers edge version.

Its more like KEEN DREAMS v1.93 REV 1 for some reason.

Keen 1,2, and 3 from id anthology are installed together

in one folder and only keen 6 comes with EGA and CGA files

but only one exe.

Also keen 4 and 5 are the goodtimes software version.

ID ANTOLOGY has 9 of the 10 games from id software lost

game collection.....they hate tiles of the dragon I guess.

title: Re: Keen patches
content:
I'm OLD so bear with me [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-annoyed.gif[/img]:"> D

I'm just curious as to why someone would want to apply a patch to go from a newer version to an older version?

Can someone please explain? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

keeners

title: Re: Keen patches
content:
Well...umm.....eh....I think this can explain every thing.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-birthday.gif[/img] then [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] I beat keen 3 [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-shikadi.gif[/img] I dont have them all [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] now I have 1, 2 and 3 [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] now there's keen 4, 5 and 6 [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img] I didn't know about keen dreams [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img] I cant buy the old versions [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] somebody make some patches [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] I cant get patches for keen 5 CGA and kdreams CGA [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-redeyes.gif[/img] Im going to be [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img] and [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] I think im going [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img] Oh well [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke.gif[/img] I can wait for someone to find them [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img] at least these other patches exist [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img]

Does it all make sense now?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]

title: patching down versions
content:
well, [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-korath.gif[/img] .... no, actually, that didn't help much. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oops.gif[/img]

I do appreciate a very good "try", however. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: patching down versions
content: for example you have keen 3 version 2.0 and you want to patch it to 3.0 but you cant because there is to v2.0 to v3.0 but there is a  patch from v2.0 to v1.0 and from v1.0 to v3.0[url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/bg/type/2/memsys.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: patching down versions
content:
Also there are those of us who like to have a "complete" collection of Keen, so our collection can only be complete if we have every single version available.

It can also be interesting to see precisely what was changed between versions.

title: Re: patching down versions
content:
So far, "there are those of us who like to have a "complete" collection of Keen" I understand the best [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

keeners

title: Re: patching down versions
content:
What you've got to understand is that the youngest of us are less than a third of your age, and thus not very sensible or mature. [Those under 18 are the worst, and that includes me]

Sometimes we do things simply because we can. [I'm a version freak myself]Szevvy Forever!
And Spleen never!

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: youth
content:
ahhhhh.... the wisdom of youth...

As us OLD ones say... "Youth is its OWN excuse" [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

keeners

title: Commander keen cheat codes.
content:
Commander Keen Cheat Codes




Episode I: Marooned on Mars/II: The Earth Explodes/III: Keen Must Die

Cheat Codes

SHIFT+TAB --------- end level

C+T+SPACEBAR ----- free items

G+O+D ------------- god mode

Durning game play press B, A, and T Free ammo

Durning normal game play press Ctrl, Tab, and Spacebar Gain all items

On the world map hold Shift + Tab to walk through to the next level Level skip

Secrets

Walk Though Uncompleted Levels

To walk though uncompleted levels, hold tab with the num lock on and walk though the level.

You will be able to walk though the level as you would if it were completed.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Episode IV: Secret of the Oracle/V: The Armageddon Machine/VI: Aliens Ate My Babysitter!

Cheat Codes

B+A+T ----- Get 99 shots, all keys, and an extra Keen
E+N+D ----- Stop game and save everyone (beat the whole darn game)
F9 --------- Boss Mode

Enable DEBUG MODE by pressing : A + 2 + ENTER, then press the following to activate the

respective cheat:


Hit F10 and one of the following keys:

B ----- Change color of border
C ----- Displays current # of objects (active and not active)
D ----- Record a demo
E ----- End level
G ----- God Mode
I ----- All items
J ----- Jump Cheat
M ----- Memory usage
N ----- No clipping mode (useful only with the map screen)
P ----- Pause game
S ----- Slow motion
T ----- Sprite test
V ----- Adds extra VBL's (VBL's??)
W ----- Warp to any level
Y ----- Shows all secret holes/steps
Z ----- Instant game over

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Episode: Keen Dreams

Type in code:

[F10 + G] God Mode!!! (Is ineffective against bottomless pits)

[F10 + I] Gives you 99 keys, 99 ammo, and 99 bombs

[F10 + J] Lets you jump as high as you want (just hold down the jump key)

[F10 + W] Warps you to a level of your choice

[F10 + S] Puts the game into slow motion

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Episode: Game Boy Color

Enter password for specific result.

Passwords:

TSRQ PNML KJHG FDCB ----- Level Select

BCDF GHJK LMNP QRST ----- Unlimited Lives
